basics.name: Kolwin Dixon
basics.label: Graduate Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a M.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2022.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI

work.summary: Served in various capacities as a supervisor, mentor, trainer, evaluator/inspector, planner, electronic repairer.
highlights: Two Duty Stations with One Deployment
Distinguished Honor Graduate from Advance Inidividual Training (AIT)
Graduated Advanced Leaders Course (ALC) with Highest Class GPA
Accepted into the Army Green to Gold Program Active Duty Option

work.summary: Responsible for the inventory and display of merchandise over night.  Performed cashier and retail sales associate responsibilities as needed.
Establish, diagnose, and troubleshoot network compuer systems and printers.
highlights: Imaged network computers for local shcools thorughout Oahu
performed network administrative duties and computer/system maintenace for local schools

work.summary: Worked closely with the Hawaii Literacy organization: Served as IT technician and subject matter expert.
highlights: Provided network installation and administration within two reading center extensions of the organization.
Conducted research on the benefits and cost analysis for the upgrade and replacement of the organizations existing computer systems.

work.summary: Food prep, Flat top cook, Fryer, Dish Washer
Supervised and train retail sales team, cashier, sales associate, inventory/recieve merchandise

volunteer.summary: Instruct class workouts and self-defense with students ranging from young children to adults, coach/mentor aspects of discipline and respect
highlights: Competed in Local and National Tournaments

volunteer.summary: Coaching basketball for 7-8 year old age group.

awards.title: Soldier of the Month
awards.summary: Demonstrated tactical knowledge of tasks through hands-on demonstration along with general Army knowledge through question and answer form in a forum of the most senor leaders of the organization.

awards.title: Military Outstanding Volunteer Service Medal
awards.awarder: US Army -- Bravo Company, 209th Aviation Support Battalion
awards.summary: Volunteered countless hours as a Taekwondo Instructor.  Trained, coached, and mentored students from the community.  This incorporated physical fitness training, competition preparation, community demonstrations, and fundraising/community volunteer events.  Ages varied from as young as 5 years of age to adults.
